intro: Clibadium surinamense, commonly known as the Surinam cluster vine, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in heads, followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
